Shepard had written 44 plays including Buried Child, which won him the Pulitzer prize for drama in 1979. He also received an Oscar nomination for best supporting actor for his role in The Right Stuff.Shepard started writing plays in the 60s. ?Back then, there was a dearth of American theatre,? he told the Observer in 2014. ?There was nothing going on. American art was starving.?His work included Angel City, Cowboy Mouth (in collaboration with Patti Smith that was written in just two nights) and a screenplay for Wim Wenders? Paris, Texas. He received Tony nominations for both Buried Child and a 2000 revival of True West.Shepard also directed many of his plays but with rare exceptions, he refrained from directing work of others. He directed two films: 1988?s Far North with then-partner Jessica Lange and 1993?s Silent Tongue, which starred Richard Harris and River Phoenix.He also collaborated with Bob Dylan for the song Brownsville Girl which featured on his 1986 album Knocked Out Loaded. As an actor, his first notable role was in Terrence Malick?s Days of Heaven in 1978. He went on to star in Baby Boom, Steel Magnolias, The Pelican Brief, Black Hawk Down, The Notebook and August: Osage County. He was most recently seen in the Netflix drama Bloodline, alongside Sissy Spacek.He was known as an acclaimed character actor rather than an A-lister, a route he chose early in his career. ?I had all kinds of wild offers at that time to be a movie star and I panicked,? he later said. ?I was turning down things like Warren Beatty?s Reds, that part of Eugene O?Neill [played by Jack Nicholson]. My agent was going crazy. I hadn?t realized what the experience of it would be like ? to be on the verge of being a movie star. Because it?s like you are the hottest whore in town. Everybody wants you.?When asked about his performances on stage, he said he wasn?t quite as comfortable as on screen. ?You don?t have to do anything in the movies,? he said in an interview with the New York Times. ?You just sit there. Well, that?s not entirely true. You do less. I find the whole situation of confronting an audience terrifying.?Before his death, he completed a role in the psychological thriller Never Here with Mireille Enos. This year also saw the release of his book The One Inside, a series of conversations with himself. He is survived by three children.Figures from both stage and screen have paid tribute to Shepard on Twitter. Writer Beau Willimon referred to him as ?fearless? and ?one of the greats?, Harlan Coben tweeted: ?How special was he? Even when you didn?t like something he?d done, you were glad you saw it? and Reese Witherspoon called him ?a truly original actor and an incredible writer?.

prediction: Tubal ligation is the tying of the fallopian tube, resulting in permanent contracepetion. Howeever, this procedure can be modified laparoscopically
reference: Laparoscopic tubal recanalization is a minimally invasive surgery aimed at reversing tubal ligation, a permanent form of contraception where the fallopian tubes are tied or blocked. Through small incisions in the abdomen, a tiny camera and specialized tools are used to reconnect the previously cut or blocked sections of the fallopian tubes. This procedure allows for the possibility of restoring fertility by reopening the tubal pathway for eggs and sperm to meet. Patients benefit from smaller incisions, minimal scarring, and quicker recovery compared to traditional open surgery. However, the success of this procedure depends on factors like the condition of the fallopian tubes and the individual's fertility factors. Before undergoing laparoscopic tubal recanalization, thorough evaluations are conducted, and the procedure is explained in detail to the patient and their partner. It's performed by skilled surgeons and offers advantages such as minimal tissue handling and reduced postoperative complications. Overall, while laparoscopic tubal recanalization provides a potential option for those seeking to reverse tubal ligation, decisions should be made after careful consideration and consultation with a healthcare professional.

prediction: Tarsem Singh’s fantasy epic, produced by Spike Jonze and David Fincher, was little seen on its original release in 2006, and now gets a rerelease in a 4K restoration on the Mubi streaming platform
reference:
Tarsem Singh’s The Fall (2006) is an ambitious, visually stunning epic that blends surreal fantasy with poignant human drama. Set in 1920s Los Angeles, it tells the story of Roy (Lee Pace), a stuntman who is bedridden and depressed after a debilitating injury. He befriends Alexandria, a young girl in the hospital, and begins to tell her a fantastical tale about five heroes on a quest to defeat an evil governor. The story unfolds as a vivid, dreamlike fantasy, with breathtaking set pieces and stunning landscapes, notably in Rajasthan, India.

While the film is visually captivating, with Gilliam-esque surrealism and lush costuming, its slow, dreamlike pacing can feel inert at times. The film also explores darker themes, as Roy's storytelling serves an ulterior motive—he is trying to manipulate Alexandria into stealing morphine for him, possibly to end his life. The film blends fantasy and reality, with characters from the hospital appearing in the story Roy narrates. Justine Waddell plays both a hospital nurse and a princess in Roy’s tale, adding layers to the narrative.

The Fall is a unique, visually rich film with a distinct style and emotional depth, though its languid pace and introspective tone may not resonate with everyone.

Safe Zones for Minorities – Rejected, as such actions fall under NATO's jurisdiction.

Support for Minority Political Parties – Also declined, being outside EU’s mandate.

* **Voice:** Trying to improve the situation (e.g., protesting). This is used when leaving is difficult (e.g., expensive to emigrate).

prediction: Q&A: Liquid fund tax Q: In the case of a Liquid fund, what is the current rate of dividend distribution tax? My CA tells me it is higher than that applicable to other debt-based schemes. Would the tax be different in case I invest in MIP of any mutual fund and opt for regular monthly dividends. Would the tax be different in case I invest in Liquid plus funds that are for all practical purposes like Liquid funds, however, the distribution tax rate on these funds is the lower at 12.5%. Nowadays, mutual funds have introduced liquid plus funds that are for all practical purposes like Liquid plus funds, however, the distribution tax rate on these funds is the lower at 12.5%. You may choose to invest in liquid-plus funds, instead of MIPs as MIPs have an element of equity component that increases their risk
reference:
### Dividend Distribution Tax on Liquid Funds vs. Other Debt-Based Schemes

For liquid funds, the current rate of Dividend Distribution Tax (DDT) is 25%, which is higher compared to other debt-based schemes such as income funds or Monthly Income Plans (MIPs), where the DDT is 12.5%. Liquid-plus funds, which are similar to liquid funds but classified differently, also have a lower DDT of 12.5%. If minimizing tax is a concern, liquid-plus funds might be a preferable option over MIPs, which carry some equity risk.

### Tax on Gains from Portfolio Management Schemes (PMS)

For Portfolio Management Schemes (PMS), taxes on gains are generally assessed based on whether the activity is classified as business or investment. Typically, PMS activities are treated as investment activities, subject to capital gains tax (STCG or LTCG) upon redemption of the PMS. However, if the transactions within the PMS are frequent and considered trading activity, they might be classified as business income by the Income Tax Officer (ITO), leading to tax under the trading income category.

Floods are natural disasters where water covers land that is usually dry. They happen when heavy rain, storms, or melting snow make rivers overflow or when dams break. Floods can be dangerous, causing damage to homes, crops, and infrastructure. People and animals may need to evacuate to stay safe.

Floods have both short-term and long-term impacts. In the short term, they can lead to immediate danger, displacement, and loss of belongings. In the long term, communities may struggle to recover, facing challenges like rebuilding homes and restoring normal life.

Preventing and preparing for floods is crucial. Early warning systems, strong infrastructure, and community education can help minimize the impact of floods. It's essential for individuals and governments to work together to reduce the risks and better respond to these natural disasters.

prediction: Vegetable’s nutritional value, making them less appealing to eat in the first place.
reference:
In our fast-paced lives, convenience often trumps nutritional value, leading to the widespread consumption of processed foods. Despite their ubiquity, many of these products pose long-term health risks, as highlighted by cardiologists and health professionals. Here are some commonly consumed items and their associated health concerns:

1. Diet Cola: Marketed as a healthier alternative due to being sugar-free, diet colas may have drawbacks. Studies suggest that artificial sweeteners can contribute to chronic kidney disease, tooth decay, and an increased risk of osteoporosis, depression, and heart disease.

2. Hot Dogs: Highly processed and containing ingredients beyond animal meat, hot dogs may include maltodextrin, which can harm the intestines and stomach. Additionally, their high sodium content poses health risks.

3. Breakfast Sandwiches:While convenient, frequent consumption of fast-food breakfast sandwiches high in cholesterol can contribute to weight gain and other health issues.

4. American Cheese Slices: Imitation cheeses with vegetable oils, trans fats, flavorings, and preservatives are less healthy than real cheeses, often identifiable by their considerably lower cost.

5. Commercial Salad Dressings: Loaded with vegetable oils, sugar, trans fats, and artificial chemicals, commercial salad dressings may undermine the health benefits of salads. Homemade alternatives with olive oil and vinegar are recommended.

6. Pre-Packaged Cupcakes: Delicious but high in sugar and containing ingredients like high fructose corn syrup, excessive consumption may contribute to obesity, diabetes, and other health problems.

7. Gummy Bears: Despite their small size, gummy bears pack a significant amount of sugar, contributing to risks associated with excessive sugar intake. Artificial ingredients like petroleum-based dyes can also pose health concerns.

8. Instant Ramen: Convenient and affordable, instant ramen is low in fiber and high in sodium, leading to potential health issues such as high blood pressure and high cholesterol with frequent consumption.

9. Cheap Bread: Inexpensive white bread, often consumed for its addictive qualities due to added sugar, high fat, and salt content, lacks sufficient fiber and may pose health risks when consumed excessively.

10. Pancakes: Popular for breakfast but not particularly healthy, pancakes often contain high amounts of salt, preservatives, trans fats, and partially hydrogenated soybean oil, contributing to cardiovascular risks with regular consumption.

This passage reports on the **Congress Party’s response** to **Anna Hazare’s hunger strike** demanding the **Lokpal Bill**, an anti-corruption legislation aimed at establishing an independent ombudsman to investigate corruption cases.

### Key Points:

* The **Prime Minister had already formed a sub-committee** led by **Defence Minister A. K. Antony** to address the **Lokpal Bill**.
* Despite this, **Anna Hazare**, a respected social activist, began a **fast unto death**, demanding stronger and immediate action.
* Congress spokesperson **Manish Tewari** described Hazare’s move as **"premature"** and **"probably unnecessary"**, since discussions were already underway.
* While the party **acknowledged respect for Hazare**, it questioned the **timing and method** of his protest.

### Context:

This situation marked the beginning of a major public movement in India against corruption. While the government viewed Hazare's protest as untimely, for many citizens, it symbolized a long-overdue demand for transparency and accountability. The tension highlighted the **gap between public sentiment and political processes**, eventually leading to widespread support for the **Jan Lokpal movement** and significant national debate on anti-corruption laws.

Translate this news article into Spanish while preserving its original meaning: 
In Mumbai, una ciudad maravillosa en la India y el centro de Tamil Nadu (India) donde se encuentra esta publicación, los precios del alquiler han aumentado considerablemente durante las últimas dos décadas. Este fenómeno ha sido impulsado por varios factores como un crecimiento exponencial de la población metropolitana, una urbanización sin control y el constante cambio climático que afecta a Mumbai con más frecuencia. Esto conduce al aumento en los precios del terreno inmobiliario, haciendo cada vez más difícil para las personas menos adineradas encontrar viviendas de calidad dentro de la ciudad.

Los expertos argumentan que este incremento es el resultado directo de un mercado real estado y está impulsando a los hogares promedio hacia áreas suburbanas donde la vida nocturna, las escuelas e infraestructura son más bajas. Además del aumento en los precios del alquiler que ocasionan dificultades para aquellos que buscan viviendas asequibles y han disminuido el acceso de la gente con menos ingresos a espacios urbanos convenientes, este fenómeno está exacerbando la desigualdad.

La investigación revela un incremento significativo en los precios del alquiler que afecta especialmente las zonas metropolitanas de Mumbai. Las personas con ingresos medios y bajos se ven obligadas a buscar opciones residenciales menos accesibles, limitando sus horarios para desplazarse largamente por el tráfico pesado en la ciudad.

La falta de políticas efectivas que limiten este crecimiento es una preocupación común entre los expertos en inmuebles y urbanismo, ya que no hay medidas sólidas desde hace un par de décadas para frenar la expansión urbana. Los profesionales del sector sugieren políticas como zonificación estricta para controlar el desarrollo infraestructural y una mayor disponibilidad de bienes raíces para aliviar este crecimiento desmesurado, sin embargo estos sugerencias están en un futuro lejano.

La ciudad ha tenido varios intentos fracasados de implementar políticas que puedan mitigar el problema del aumento del precio del alquiler y la segregación social antes mencionada por parte de los expertos urbanistas, sin embargo estos esfuerzos no han dado resultados. Los residentes están desesperanzados acerca de encontrar una solución rápida para este problema urbano que ha crecido en Mumbai y otras ciudades como ella.
